sn44.9:2.1: Compare the similar passage at MN 77:6.3, which also introduces the six ascetic teachers.
sn44.9:5.4: The simile of the fire going out for lack of fuel is famously discussed with Vacchagotta in MN 72.
sn44.9:6.4: This is one of several passages that acknowledge an “in-between state” after death and before rebirth. See also SN 12.11:1.3, SN 35.87:11.8, SN 46.3:9.5. | In parallel phrases, aññataraṁ qualifies the realm of rebirth (eg. AN 6.34:1.5: aññataraṁ brahmalokaṁ upapanno). This must be the meaning of the second kāya here, rather than “body”. | I read satto as “attached”, since one who has been freed would not be reborn.
